intro: Palala attenuata, commonly known as the slender palala, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and a prominent tube shape. Palala attenuata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
